intro: Sisyrinchium paramorum, commonly known as the Sierra daisy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers with a central disk. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces numerous small, daisy-like blooms in the summer. Sisyrinchium paramorum is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in high elevation areas.
